entities.Name: AI Actions
entities.Description: List of all actions that are possible across all AI Models

entities.Name: AI Model Actions
entities.Description: Tracks the actions supported by each AI Model

entities.Name: AI Model Types
entities.Description: Types of AI Models

entities.Name: AI Models
entities.Description: Catalog of all AI Models configured in the system.

entities.Name: Application Entities
entities.Description: List of entities within each application. An application can have any number of entities and an entity can be part of any number of applications.

entities.Name: Applications
entities.Description: Applications are used to group entities in the user interface for ease of user access

entities.Name: Companies
entities.Description: A list of organizational units within your business. These can be subsidiaries or divisions or other units. Companies are used to organizae employee records and also for separating integrations if you have multiple integrations of the same type of system.

entities.Name: Company Integrations
entities.Description: Links individual company records to specific integrations

entities.Name: Dashboards
entities.Description: Dashboards are used to group resources into a single display pane for an end-user

entities.Name: Data Context Items
entities.Description: Data Context Items store information about each item within a Data Context. Each item stores a link to a view, query, or raw sql statement and can optionally cache the JSON representing the last run of that data object as well.

Fields.Name: DataContextID
Fields.Description: Foreign key to the DataContext table

Fields.Name: Type
Fields.Description: The type of the item, either "view", "query", "full_entity", "single_record", or "sql"

Fields.Name: ViewID
Fields.Description: Only used if Type='view'

Fields.Name: QueryID
Fields.Description: Only used if Type='query'

Fields.Name: EntityID
Fields.Description: Used if type='full_entity' or type='single_record'

Fields.Name: RecordID
Fields.Description: The Primary Key value for the record, only used when Type='single_record'

Fields.Name: SQL
Fields.Description: Only used when Type=sql

Fields.Name: DataJSON
Fields.Description: Optionally used to cache results of an item. This can be used for performance optimization, and also for having snapshots of data for historical comparisons.

Fields.Name: LastRefreshedAt
Fields.Description: If DataJSON is populated, this field will show the date the the data was captured

entities.Name: Data Contexts
entities.Description: Data Contexts are a primitive within the MemberJunction architecture. They store information about data contexts which are groups of data including views, queries, or raw SQL statements. Data contexts can be used in conversations, reports and more.

entities.Name: Dataset Items
entities.Description: A single item in a Dataset and can be sourced from multiple methods.

entities.Name: Datasets
entities.Description: Cacheable sets of data that can span one or more items

entities.Name: Employees
entities.Description: A list of employees across all units of your organization

entities.Name: Entities
entities.Description: Catalog of all entities across all schemas

Fields.Name: AutoUpdateDescription
Fields.Description: When set to 1 (default), whenever a description is modified in the underlying view (first choice) or table (second choice), the Description column in the entity definition will be automatically updated. If you never set metadata in the database directly, you can leave this alone. However, if you have metadata set in the database level for description, and you want to provide a DIFFERENT description in this entity definition, turn this bit off and then set the Description field and future CodeGen runs will NOT override the Description field here.

entities.Name: Entity AI Actions
entities.Description: Tracks the AI actions that should be invoked based on changes to records within a given entity.

Fields.Name: Status
Fields.Description: Can be Pending, In Progress, Completed, or Failed

entities.Name: Entity Fields
entities.Description: List of all fields within each entity with metadata about each field

Fields.Name: AutoUpdateDescription
Fields.Description: When set to 1 (default), whenever a description is modified in the column within the underlying view (first choice) or table (second choice), the Description column in the entity field definition will be automatically updated. If you never set metadata in the database directly, you can leave this alone. However, if you have metadata set in the database level for description, and you want to provide a DIFFERENT description in this entity field definition, turn this bit off and then set the Description field and future CodeGen runs will NOT override the Description field here.

entities.Name: Entity Permissions
entities.Description: Security settings for each entity

entities.Name: Entity Relationships
entities.Description: Metadata about relationships between entities including display preferences for the UI

Fields.Name: Sequence
Fields.Description: Used for display order in generated forms and in other places in the UI where relationships for an entity are shown

Fields.Name: Status
Fields.Description: Pending, Uploading, Uploaded, Deleting, Deleted

entities.Name: Integration URL Formats
entities.Description: Used to generate web links for end users to easily access resources in a source system. URL Formats support templating to inject various field values at run-time to take a user directly to a resource in a source system.

entities.Name: Integrations
entities.Description: Catalog of all integrations that have been configured in the system.

entities.Name: List Details
entities.Description: Tracks the records within each list.

entities.Name: Lists
entities.Description: Static lists are useful for controlling a set of data for a given entity. These can be used programatically for applications like logging and tracking long-running tasks and also by end users for tracking any particular list of records they want to directly control the set.

entities.Name: Queries
entities.Description: Catalog of stored queries. This is useful for any arbitrary query that is known to be performant and correct and can be reused. Queries can be viewed/run by a user, used programatically via RunQuery, and also used by AI systems for improved reliability instead of dynamically generated SQL. Queries can also improve security since they store the SQL instead of using dynamic SQL.

Fields.Name: SQLBaseType
Fields.Description: The base type, not including parameters, in SQL. For example this field would be nvarchar or decimal, and wouldn't include type parameters. The SQLFullType field provides that information.

Fields.Name: SQLFullType
Fields.Description: The full SQL type for the field, for example datetime or nvarchar(10) etc.

entities.Name: Queues
entities.Description: Queues can be used to async execute long running tasks

entities.Name: Record Changes
entities.Description: For entities that have TrackRecordChanges=1, Record Changes will store the history of all changes made within the system. For integrations you can directly add values here if you have inbound signals indicating records were changed in a source system. This entity only automatically captures Record Changes if they were made within the system.

entities.Name: Roles
entities.Description: Roles are used for security administration and can have zero to many Users as members

Fields.Name: Description
Fields.Description: Description of the role

Fields.Name: DirectoryID
Fields.Description: The unique ID of the role in the directory being used for authentication, for example an ID in Azure.

Fields.Name: SQLName
Fields.Description: The name of the role in the database, this is used for auto-generating permission statements by CodeGen

entities.Name: Schema Info
entities.Description: Tracks the schemas in the system and the ID ranges that are valid for entities within each schema.

entities.Name: Skills
entities.Description: A hierarchical list of possible skills that are linked to Employees and can also be linked to any other entity

entities.Name: Tagged Items
entities.Description: Tracks the links between any record in any entity with Tags

entities.Name: Tags
entities.Description: Tags are used to arbitrarily associate any record in any entity with addtional information.

entities.Name: User Favorites
entities.Description: Records that each user can mark as a favorite for easy access

entities.Name: User View Run Details
entities.Description: Tracks the set of records that were included in each run of a given user view.

entities.Name: User View Runs
entities.Description: User Views can be logged when run to capture the date and user that ran the view as well as the output results.

entities.Name: User Views
entities.Description: Views are sets of records within a given entity defined by filtering rules. Views can be used programatically to retrieve dynamic sets of data and in user interfaces like MJ Explorer for end-user consumption.

entities.Name: Users
entities.Description: A list of all users who have or had access to the system

Fields.Name: Type
Fields.Description: What type of installation was applied

Fields.Name: Status
Fields.Description: Pending, Complete, Failed

Fields.Name: InstallLog
Fields.Description: Any logging that was saved from the installation process

Fields.Name: Comments
Fields.Description: Optional, comments the administrator wants to save for each installed version

Fields.Name: AutoRunEnabled
Fields.Description: If set to 1, the workflow will be run automatically on the interval specified by the AutoRunIntervalType and AutoRunInterval fields

Fields.Name: AutoRunIntervalUnits
Fields.Description: Minutes, Hours, Days, Weeks, Months, Years

Fields.Name: AutoRunInterval
Fields.Description: The interval, denominated in the units specified in the AutoRunIntervalUnits column, between auto runs of this workflow.

Fields.Name: SubclassName
Fields.Description: If specified, this subclass key, via the ClassFactory, will be instantiated, to execute this workflow. If not specified the WorkflowBase class will be used by default.

entities.Name: Workspace Items
entities.Description: Tracks the resources that are active within a given worksapce

entities.Name: Workspaces
entities.Description: A user can have one or more workspaces
